dialogue.introduction: I am Umikaze, the Seventh of the Shiratsuyu-class Destroyer, and the First of the Revised Shiratsuyu-class. I'll be in your care, Admiral!
dialogue.library_intro: I am Umikaze, the Seventh of the Shiratsuyu Class Destroyer, and the First of the Revised Shiratsuyu Class. I was built according to the 2nd Naval Armaments Supplement Program. I participated in the Battle of Guadalcanal, as part of the 2nd Torpedo Squadron. I will be in your care, Admiral.
dialogue.secretary2: Kawakaze? Well, what is it? Whoa!? Admiral!? Please, excuse me! Huh? Uhm....
dialogue.secretary3: Ah, the Bridge? Yes, as for the Umikaze-class... Ah, I'm sorry. It's Revised Shiratsuyu-class.
dialogue.secretaryidle: Admiral? Admi...ral? He seems busy. Maybe I should go see how Kawakaze is doing? But there is no way to know when he will need me...
dialogue.secretarymarried: Admiral, are you not tired? Really? Are you okay? Your health is important. Please do not push yourself too hard. Ah, Umikaze will make some tea.
dialogue.wedding: Did you call for Umikaze, Admiral? You plan to summon the Revised Shiratsuyu-class and.. Ah, that's not it? This is... Really? Wow, I'm so happy!
dialogue.show_players_score: The information, Admiral? Yes, Umikaze will bring it for you.
dialogue.joining_a_fleet: First of the Upgraded Shiratsuyu-class, Umikaze, setting sail!
dialogue.equipment1: Thank you very much, Admiral. I'm happy to become stronger.
dialogue.equipment2: Uh... Uhm. If it is okay, I would be happy if the same can be done for Kawakaze.
dialogue.supply: Ah, thank you for the resupply. It helps.
dialogue.docking_minor_damage: I'm sorry. I'll be in the dock for a bit.
dialogue.docking_moderate_damage: I'm sorry... I'll take your word and let my wounds heal thoroughly.
dialogue.ship_construction: It seems that a new ship girl has arrived.
dialogue.return_from_sortie: Fleet has returned safely to port. Thank you for the hard work! Phew...
dialogue.start_a_sortie: 24th Destroyer Division, leaving port! Everyone, follow me please!
dialogue.attack: It is just like the Solomons... I will fight this time!
dialogue.night_battle: We will clear the remaining enemy through night battle! All fleet charge! Everyone, follow me please!
dialogue.mvp: Umikaze is the top? Th-thank you! It's a bit embarrassing...
dialogue.minor_damaged1: No! I'm hit? Wh-what is it?
dialogue.minor_damaged2: Kyaa! What is it? Torpedo? Enemy ship?!
dialogue.moderately_damaged: I was hit heavily. This place is... dangerous.
dialogue.sunk: It seems like Umikaze... ends here... Kawakaze... you... take your time... okay?
dialogue.fall_2015: Sweet potatoes taste delicious in autumn, don't they? Admiral, shall I make steamed sweet potatoes? I'll prepare some tea as well. Just wait a little.
dialogue.fall_event_2015: Kawakaze, do try and take care of yourself a bit more... really, your big sister is worried about you...
dialogue.christmas_2015: Admiral, today it is a festival.The fir tree is also lovely decorated. Umikaze is happy.
dialogue.end_of_year_2015: Admiral, it went fast. It's already December. I also have to clean the naval base. Ah, it's fine. Leave it to Umikaze.
dialogue.new_year_2016: Happy New Year, Admiral! Please take care of the 24th Destroyer Division and me this year as well!
dialogue.setsubun_2016: Setsubun, is it? Hwah! Kawakaze, throwing beans at Sendai like that is...Ah-, Awawah! Sendai, I'm sorry! I u-um...I'm sorry!

hourly.0000: Admiral, Umikaze will be by your side to alert you of the time today. Ah, I'll brew some more tea.
hourly.0100: Admiral, it is 0100. Fleet in the night is... quiet as well.
hourly.0200: Admiral, it is 0200. Do you feel a little sleepy? Then I will make a strong tea.
hourly.0300: Admiral, it is 0300. Should I make black tea sometimes? Ah, no. I guess green tea is the best. Here it is.
hourly.0400: Admiral, it is 0400. It's almost morning... Admiral, do you want to take a short nap? It's alright because Umikaze will be awake.
hourly.0500: Admiral, it is 0500. It is... morning. Mmmpph, it is a nice morning. Let's strive today as well.
hourly.0600: Admiral, it is 0600. I'll make the wake-up call to the fleet. All fleet, wake up! Good morning!
hourly.0700: Admiral, it is 0700. I've prepared your breakfast as well. Today's fish is split mackerel. I'll get the tea now.
hourly.0800: Admiral, it is 0800. After I'm done with the laundry, I'll get to checking the fleet composition and expedition. I'm sorry, please wait.
hourly.0900: Admiral, it is 0900. I have finished checking today's fleet composition and expeditions. What will you do about the morning's sortie?
hourly.1000: Admiral, it is 1000. Will you send the fleet to the South? Oh, should we prioritize the supply transport mission?
hourly.1100: Admiral, it is 1100. My sisters? Yes, they are my pride. I wonder if Kawakaze is doing well? Ehehe.
hourly.1200: Admiral, it is 1200. Leave the lunch to Umikaze as well. How about curry? Ah, curry udon sounds good too.
hourly.1300: Admiral, it is 1300. Ah, didn't some curry get flung out? Are you okay? Curry stains are hard to get off, right?..... Ah , it's okay. Good.
hourly.1400: Admiral, it is 1400. Ah, Jintsuu-san, you must be busy. Ah, right. 24th Destroyer Division is doing well. It's okay.
hourly.1500: Admiral, it is 1500. Being part of the 2nd Torpedo Squadron is a great pride, but it makes me nervous. Yes...
hourly.1600: Admiral, it is 160... Suzukaze! It must be tiring. You are full of energy. Ehehe, keep it up!
hourly.1700: Admiral, it is 1700. Ah... What is it Michishio? Eh? AsashioÂ ? I haven't seen her... are you searching for her?
hourly.1800: Admiral, it is 1800. Umikaze will start preparing the dinner. I wonder what would be good tonight?
hourly.1900: Admiral, it is 1900. Your evening meal is ready. Tonight's menu is chicken rice. How is it? Is it good?
hourly.2000: Admiral, it's 2000. Hm, Kawakaze? You're sortieing with Sendai for a night battle? Ah... be careful! Do your best!
hourly.2100: Admiral, it's 2100. Ah... I'm a bit worried about Kawakaze. If anything really happened...
hourly.2200: Admiral, it's 2200. Kawakaze made it back to the port safely, thank goodness. Thank you for your hard work too, Sendai-san!
hourly.2300: Admiral, it is 2300. It has been a hard day of work today. Let's keep our diligence tomorrow too.
